result.execSummary:
The defendant Zakkari M. Benter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All Financial obligations shall be paid to the Clerk of Courts within 60 days unless a payment plan is established.

Shall serve 90 days DCJ w/h&t commencing on/before 9/24/16
Consecutive to: with work release and transfer privileges

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant, Zakkari M. Benter in court, Pam appeared for Clerk of Courts; agreement reached for $25/bi-weekly via WA from Walkers; Court so orders; address is 305 Jefferson, #25, BD, WI
Payment hearing on July 20, 2017 at 12:30 pm.
Payment plan granted in the amount of $50 per month commencing on 1/1/17 until paid in full
Shall submit a DNA sample

Defendant Zakkari M. Benter in court with attorney Brian J. Smith.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recomm heard by Atty Sempf.  DEF pleas no contest as charged.  PQWOR filed/reviewed.  Court uses criminal complaint as factual basis.   Court finds plea was made FVKI and accepts plea.  Court finds factual basis.  Court finds DEF guilty as charged.  State heard and makes recomm - DEF refuses probation so asks for jail time. Atty Smith heard and makes recomm.  Court heard/will not follow plea agreement.  Court orders:

90 Days DCJ - Report on or before 9/24/2016 by 6:00 pm
Court Costs
DNA Sample

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with SET, dob 3/29/83.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 410 W. Burnett Street, Beaver Dam, WI.  Payment of warrant fees in the amount of $40.00 by next court date.

(12:54) Defendant Zakkari M. Benter in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn Shelton for Brian J. Smith.  Kurt Frederich Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
